reviewText: This was a very well done documentary on the history of the Dead Sea Scrolls.  It was fascinating to see where the scrolls are held on display to the public, some of the behind the scenes of repairing and maintaining the scrolls, as well as a brief history of how they were found.  This is highly recommended as it is done sort of Dragnet style, 'just the facts'.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you ever want to understand the Dead Sea Scrolls, this is the documentary for you! I am thinking about recommending it to my Bible Study Group.
summary: Secrets of the Dead Sea Scrolls
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was disappointed with this dvd on the Dead Sea Scrolls in that I was told more about the people of the area than the scrolls themselves.  I wanted information on the Dead Sea Scrolls themselves > what writings were on them, reference to the Bible, more in depth details about them not the geographic peoples etc
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Louis J. Sheehan "Louis J. Sheehan, Esquire"
reviewText: This is primarily a DVD about the Essenes and Qumran.  The DVD records convincing evaluations of evidence.  But what secrets?!?  Louis J Sheehan
summary: The Essenes and Qumran -- Louis J Sheehan
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's a great introduction to the Dead Sea Scrolls : where they were found, who hid them there & why? Science confirms the authenticity of the texts written more than 2000 years ago by the Essenes sect. The documentary stays away from controversy by sticking to the science & the generally accepted dogma on the texts. Great introduction to this important find of our time!
summary: "Great Introduction To The Dead Sea Scrolls".
Title: N/A
